name: Run Wild - Trail Run Finder
description: First group project during the bootcamp, starting to learning how to read documentation, the requirement was to use a CSS framework different than Bootstrap that we have used in class, we used Semantic UI. We were also required to use e not used in the course a third-party API.

name: Fresh Lemons - Movie Rating App
description: Second project during the bootcamp, in this phase of the course the minimal requirements of the project was to use NODE, EXPRESS, mySQL and React, also we had to make sure our folder structure meets the MVC paradigm.

name: Run to the Sun
description: This was the final project of the bootcamp, in this project the minimal requirements were was to use ReactJS, Node and Express Web Server database with sequelize or mongoose ORM. We were able to make our fun app fully authenticaded, we used React and Redux and Mongoose ORM. Using multiple schemas and working with react router and Redux helped us understand really well the concept of each technology.

name: Good README Generator
description: Bootcamp homework using Node.js and Github API request

name: Employee Summary
description: Bootcamp homework using Node.js and Github API request

name: Note Taker
description: Bootcamp homework using Express.js and other libraries. At this point on the bootcamp we had just started connecting the backend to the frontend, it was like finding the golden pot on the other side of the rainbow. Also, we learned how to deploy the app with database on heroku

name: Employee Tracker
description: Fun assignment, at this point of the boot-camp we were learning the backend enviroment, for this assigment we used Node.js, inquirer and MySQL. I remember the joy on seeing how to store and utilize information in a database

name: Weather Dashboard
description: Boot-camp homework, at this point of the course we started to learn to work with third-party API request, with multiple different queries
